intro: Limacia cerasifera, commonly known as the cherry-leaf snailwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves that resemble cherry leaves, hence its common name. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Limacia cerasifera is a perennial herb that is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
